content.text: Encephalitis or meningitis can be an early or late manifestations of Lyme Disease; Early disease typically presents as meningitis, cranial neuritis, radiculoneuritis, and more rarelyencephalomyelitis, and has a more rapid onset of illness. Later onset neuroborrelia disease can involve peripheral or central nervous system and the onset is more insidious.

items: Cranial nerve palsy; most often 7th cranial nerve
Headache and neck pain with CSF picture consistent with a lymphocytic aseptic meningitis
Cognitive impairment: poor memory, depression, somnolence
May have other associated late-stage manifestations: carditis or arthritis; usually early in course; maybe isolated finding

referenceData.text: For details on diagnostic methods see: Lyme Disease, Diagnosis.

components.dose: 2 gm IV q24h (adult) or 50-75 mg/kg IV q24h (child)

content.text: Pediatrics: Doxycycline can be safely administered for up to 21 days regardless of age (AAP Red Book 2018, Section 4; J Pediatr 166:1246, 2015).
